content: spider on web wreath designed by crochetcrafters1 © 2024 crochetcrafters1 - all rights reserved this pattern and its contents are only for personal use do not copy edit redistribute or sell this pattern you are welcome to sell finished products with your own photos in small quantities but if you do so please give pattern credit to crochetcrafters1 thank you and enjoy stitches and abbreviations - this pattern is written in us terminology st/sts stitch/stitches slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet inv decrease invisible decrease tools and materials - 5 mm crochet hook - bernat premium #4 worsted medium yarn - dark grey white black and green - yarn needle - scissors - stuffing - safety eyes - foam ring inside diameter of about 24 cm and ring thickness of about 6 cm final size - diameter of 34cm technical notes *the spider is worked in spirals so use a stitch marker to indicate the start of a round *at the end of each round/row is a stitch count in brackets *stitch count does not include chains wreath i would recommend making the wreath at least 2 different colours row 1 chain 1000 *fasten_off if you are making the wreath multiple colours make all the chains first then wrap them around the foam ring together you will probably run out of yarn while wrapping the chains around the ring that is fine just lock in what you have so far and make more chains and start wrapping around the foam ring again if you notice you made your chain too long and you have too much left over when wrapping the ring just cut the chain shorter remember people are only going to see the front of the wreath so you can make the back of the wreath a mess if you want web make four row 1 my chain was 38 then fasten_off make the chain about the attach the four chains use white yarn to go length of the diameter of like so through the chains to your foam ring make the rest of the web spider dark grey round 1 make a magic_ring into the magic_ring make 6 single_crochet 6 sts round 2 make 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts round 3 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around 18 sts round 4 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next 2 sts repeat around 24 sts round 5-8 make 1 single_crochet in each st around 24 sts round 9 make 1 single_crochet inv decrease followed by 1 single_crochet in the next 2 sts repeat around 18 sts round 10 make 1 single_crochet inv decrease followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around 12 sts round 11 make 6 single_crochet inv decrease 6 sts round 12 make 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts *start stuffing round 13-14 make 1 single_crochet in each st around 12
